Course_Name: Circular Economy for the Built Environment (SS24): Principles, Practices and Methods

Messages.Author: Mohamed Abdelfattah
Messages.Content: Dear all, Due to the weather condition, I offer today’s support session online during the usual time: 14:15-15:45.  Here is the link for the session: https://bbb.innocampus.tu-berlin.de/rooms/abd-aay-jxc-8zw/join  Best regards, Mohamed

Messages.Author: Mohamed Abdelfattah
Messages.Content: Dear all, Yesterday I posted if you would like to present in the final presentation next week. This is just to announce it again.  Please sign up if you would like to present your preliminary results in the final lecture next week. You should do that by the end of this weekend: Sunday, 14.07.2024. Best regards, Mohamed

Messages.Author: Mohamed Abdelfattah
Messages.Content: Dear all, Please prepare a 4-minute pitch for this week. Please stick to the time as we expect 18 students to present. Best regards, Mo

Messages.Author: Mohamed Abdelfattah
Messages.Content: Hi all, I just posted a poll on ISIS. Please answer in you want to present your proposal next week.  ------ For us to plan the time for presentations, please register here if you want to present your project next week during the lecture by the end of this week: June, 7th. If you register, we expect you to be there! Thanks and best regards, Mo

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Welcome to Circular Economy for the Built Environment!

Messages.Author: Mohamed Abdelfattah
Messages.Content: Dear students, Welcome to our circular economy for the built environment module. As discussed in the lecture, you can now see the project file with submission dates and examples from previous years. My advice as usual: please start early with your project and start to think about the topic and of course use the time in support sessions (Mondays and Wednesdays: 14:00 to 16:00) to ask and discuss further! Best regards, Mohamed

Forums.Forum_name: Discussion forum about the term project

Messages.Author: Rezan Haydar Jan Firtina
Messages.Content: I got a couple questions regarding the proposal and the pitch presentation: Will the pitch presentation be evaluated or just the proposal document we upload?  If yes, are there any requirements (how long it may be, etc.) ? Can we upload the proposal document earlier than the 12th of June and do we have to wait for our pitch to be accepted or can we keep working on the project anyways?

Messages.Author: Daniel Bräuer
Messages.Content: Hello,  as mentioned in todays lecture: here is the documentation about how the DIN-regualations make it sometimes more difficult and more expensive to build new housing projects and how intransparent those regulations - are even if they suggest otherwise. It is in german but subtitles might be available. https://youtu.be/hLT-W55y-LI?si=EblzF0V52uJuQ0coVom Bürokratiewahnsinn im Wohnungsbau. Viele Normen-Teure Wohnungen? | SWR Doku
